coding assessment for the first round of elimination. The shortlisted candidates work on the
business problem statement to submit a technical solution for the same, based on which the
participants are shortlisted for the hiring process and the National Finals.

Key Milestones

Flipkart GRiD 7.0 will move across 4 milestones, with each stage acting as a qualifier for the next
one. The stages and challenges posed during the entire phase are designed to give the
participants a flavor of relevant and interesting problems from the ecommerce ecosystem,
assessing you on your problem solving, critical thinking, technical aptitude, and coding skills.

* Round 1: Screening

The registered candidates will undergo a screening process where their academic performance
and consistency, along with non-academic achievements and other accolades will be considered.
The shortlisted candidates will proceed to the next stage.

* Round 2: Coding Assessment

The shortlisted candidates will then appear for a proctored coding assessment that will consist of
3 questions to be attempted in 90 minutes, covering languages like Python, Java, C, C++ etc.. The
scores will be calculated based on the clearance of test cases for these questions, and the ones
which are equal to or higher than the cutoff score will move to the next round.

* Round 3: Case Study-based Code

The shortlisted candidates will receive a business problem statement of Flipkart and will be asked
to solve the same through Tech. This will require you to build a tool or system level solution for the
proposed problem, and share the code for the same. The detailed brief of the round will be given
to the relevant participants when the round will go live.

* Round 4: National Finals
